clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Oxytocin Nasal Sprays on Social Behavior in Social Anxiety Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Oxytocin on Pro-Social Behavior in Social Anxiety Disorder

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to learn more about how the hormone, oxytocin, impacts social behavior in terms of cooperation with others, attention processing, and reward processing, among patients with social anxiety disorder. Based on available research, the investigators predict that in patients with social anxiety disorder, oxytocin will improve social cooperation during an online ball-tossing game called Cyberball, reduce attention toward socially threatening cues during a dot-probe task, and lead to greater willingness to work for monetary rewards for others rather than themselves during an effort expenditure task.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Basic Science

primary_outcome.description: Distribution of ball tosses to other players during online ball-tossing task
Number of times participants chose high cost/high reward trials (compared to low cost/low reward trials)
Difference scores in response latencies on disengagement trials for threat versus non-threat cues

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Trust Scores on a 1-7 Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate their perceived level of trust (on a 1-7 Likert scale) toward each of the 3 other players they interacted with during online ball-tossing task.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Empathy Scores on a 1-7 Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate their level of perceived empathy (on a 1-7 Likert scale) with the 3 other players they interacted with during online ball-tossing task.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Preference Scores on a 1-7 Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate their level of preference (on a 1-7 Likert scale) for each of the 3 players they interacted with during online ball-tossing task.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived Rejection Scores on a 1-7 Likert Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will rate their level of perceived rejection (on a 1-7 Likert scale) from each of the 3 other players they interacted with during online ball-tossing task.

arm_group.description: Liquid intranasal oxytocin, 24 IU, administered once

intervention.description: Liquid metered-dose nasal spray, 24 IU, administered once

facility.name: Center for Anxiety and Related Disorders at Boston University
